com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection

Class SSLSocketConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection.ConnectionBase
        • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection.SocketConnection
          • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection.SSLSocketConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, Serializable

    public class SSLSocketConnection
extends SocketConnection
    JSSE SSL Socket implementation of a Connection interface. Extends the SocketConnection class to use SSLSockets.

    Once constructed, a SSLSocketConnection can be treated in every way as a SocketConnection, yet it still retains its SSL behaviour.

    Author:
    Christopher J Burton, 04/Dec/2001, revised 07/Feb/2003 & 20/Sep/2011.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • SSLSocketConnection

        public SSLSocketConnection(String hostName,
                           int port,
                           int timeout)
        When started, this will try to connect to a server socket at the given hostName and port within the specified timeout. The timeout is considered to be in milliseconds and a timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        hostName - The name of the host system to connect to.
        port - The port number to connect to on the host system.
        timeout - The timeout within the connection should be established.

      • SSLSocketConnection

        public SSLSocketConnection(InetAddress ipAddress,
                           int port,
                           int timeout)
        When started this will try to connect to a server socket at the given Internet address and port within the specified timeout. The timeout is considered to be in milliseconds and a timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - The Internet address of the host system to connect to.
        port - The port number to connect to on the host system.
        timeout - The timeout within the connection should be established.

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyStoreType

        public void setKeyStoreType(String keyStoreType)
        Allows the user to specify explicitly the type of the key store. If the key store type has not been set at the time the start() method is called, we will attempt to determine the type from the key store file name extension, defaulting to "JKS".
        Parameters:
        keyStoreType - A key store type that is understood by your Java security manager. Standard types are "PKCS12", "JCEKS" and "JKS" (the default).

      • setTrustStoreType

        public void setTrustStoreType(String trustStoreType)
        Allows the user to specify explicitly the type of the trust store. If the trust store type has not been set at the time the start() method is called, we will attempt to determine the type from the trust store file name extension, defaulting to "JKS".
        Parameters:
        trustStoreType - A trust store type that is understood by your Java security manager. Standard types are "JCEKS" and "JKS" (the default). You may also specify "DER-encoded" if you wish to use a raw certificate file.

      • setKeyManagerFactory

        public void setKeyManagerFactory(KeyManagerFactory keyManagerFactory)
        Allow the user to specify explicitly a KeyManagerFactory. If no KeyManagerFactory is specified, we will use the default. Most users will not need to use this method.
        Parameters:
        keyManagerFactory - a KeyManagerFactory

      • setTrustManagerFactory

        public void setTrustManagerFactory(TrustManagerFactory trustManagerFactory)
        Allow the user to specify explicitly a TrustManagerFactory. If no TrustManagerFactory is specified, we will use the default. Most users will not need to use this method.
        Parameters:
        trustManagerFactory - a TrustManagerFactory

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IOException
        This is called to start the SSLSocketConnection. We intercept it to ensure our key store manager is in place, then call the parent class's start method.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Connection
        Overrides:
        start in class SocketConnection
        Throws:
        IOException - if the attempt to make a connection failed.
        SocketTimeoutException - if timeout expires before connecting.

      • createSocket

        protected Socket createSocket(String hostname,
                              int port,
                              String localHost,
                              int localPort,
                              int timeout)
                       throws IOException
        This method is overriden to return with a connected SSLSocket. If a proxy configured the connection will use it.
        Overrides:
        createSocket in class SocketConnection
        Parameters:
        hostname - Name of host we want a socket to.
        port - Port number to connect to.
        localHost - Our host address - the socket will bind to the local address and port supplied. If the specified host is null it is the equivalent to specifying an address of the loopback interface and localPort is not used by the method.
        localPort - Our local port.
        timeout - Timeout for the connect in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        a connected socket
        Throws:
        IOException - if the attempt to make a connection failed.

      • createServerSocket

        protected ServerSocket createServerSocket(int port)
                                   throws IOException
        This method of the parent SocketConnection class must be reimplemented by each subclass to return a ServerSocket of the correct type. For working with SSLSocketConnections we require an SSLServerSocket, so this implementation returns an SSLServerSocket that is configured according to the attributes of this SSLSocketConnection.
        Overrides:
        createServerSocket in class SocketConnection
        Parameters:
        port - a port
        Returns:
        a connected socket
        Throws:
        IOException - if an exception occurs when connecting

        Parameters:

      • getSSLSession

        public SSLSession getSSLSession()
        Get the SSLSession associated with this SSLSocket being used by this SSLSocketConnection.

        Much useful information can be found from the SSLSession, including the certificate chain that has been presented by the other party. The certificate chain can be accessed in this way: 

         javax.net.ssl.SSLSession sslSession = sslSocketConnection.getSSLSession();
 javax.security.cert.X509Certificate[] certs = sslSession.getPeerCertificateChain();
 for (int i = 0; i < certs.length; i++) {
   System.out.println("certs[" + i + "] = " + certs[i]);
 }

        Returns:
        The SSLSession associated with the SSLSocket being used by this SSLSocketConnection.

      • setKeyStore

        public void setKeyStore(String fileName,
                        String password)
        Let the user define the "key store". This is the database file that contains a PrivateKey and a Certificate if the user is to operate as a server or is to respond to a server's request for client authentication.

        Note that each key store should contain only a single PrivateKey, so that this sole PrivateKey is certain to be the one that is used. Otherwise, if a key store contains two or more keys, a PrivateKey will be chosen without the user having any control over which key is chosen.

        If no specific key store is specified for this SSLSocketConnection, the default JSSE properties " javax.net.ssl.keyStore" and "javax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword" will be used if they have been set.

        The key store file can be in any supported key store format. You can explicitly specify the key store type by calling setKeyStoreType(String). Otherwise the type will be determined from the key store file name. If the file ends in ".pfx" or ".p12" then the assumed type is "PKCS12". If the file ends in ".jceks" than the assumed type is "JCEKS". For all other file extensions the default type of "JKS" is assumed.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the key store file.
        password - The password needed to access the key store file.

      • setTrustStore

        public void setTrustStore(String fileName)
        Let the user define the "trust store". This is the database file that contains all of the Certificates that a user is prepared to trust. The trust store can contain one or many Certificates. No password is necessary.

        If no specific trust store is specified for this SSLSocketConnection, the default JSSE property " javax.net.ssl.trustStore" will be used if it has been set.

        The trust store file can be in any supported key store format. You can explicitly specify the trust store type by calling setTrustStoreType(String). Otherwise the type will be determined from the trust store file name. If the file ends in ".cer" it is assumed to be a raw certificate file and will be loaded into a newly-created key store transparently. If the file ends in ".jceks" than the assumed type is "JCEKS". For all other file extensions the default type of "JKS" is assumed.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the trust store file.

      • getKeyStore

        public String getKeyStore()
        Get the name of the key store used by this SSLSocketConnection.
        Returns:
        The name of the key store, or null if it has not been defined.

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Overrides:
        configure in class SocketConnection
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.
